name: Dark Dugtrio

abilities.name: Sinkhole
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this power does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working while Dark Dugtrio is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Knock Down
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if heads, this attack does 20 damage.

flavorText: Digs large sinkholes in the ground and tries to trap its enemies in them.

strengths: Forces opponent into difficult retreat decisions
Knock Down has opponent flip, so bad luck hurts them
weaknesses: Very low 50 HP for a Stage 1
Grass weakness is problematic vs Scyther
synergies: Gust of Wind (force switches, trigger Sinkhole)
counters: Scyther - Grass type with free retreat

competitiveHistory: Dark Dugtrio was a unique disruption card that punished opponents for retreating. However, its extremely low 50 HP made it very vulnerable, and Sinkhole only triggered 50% of the time. It saw some niche play in decks that wanted to punish switching, but was never a meta staple.

rulings.ruling: Sinkhole triggers whenever the opponent's Active Pokemon retreats - even if forced to switch by Gust of Wind (which is not retreating).
Sinkhole does not trigger when Pokemon are switched by trainer cards or effects - only actual retreating.
The opponent flips for Knock Down, not you. Tails is bad for them.
